data.question: What is the melting temperature of Co(hmba)3[Co(NCS)4]?
Which compound has the highest viscosity near its melting temperature?
Is the melting transition of Mn(bba)3[MnCl4] reversible?
What method is used for variable-temperature viscosity measurements?
What is the purpose of using Fourier-Transformed Infrared Spectroscopy (FTIR) in the study?
data.answer: To confirm that all lattice solvent has been released and to study hydrogen bonding interactions

data.question: What does the Pair Distribution Function (PDF) analysis reveal about the liquid phase of Co(bba)3[CoCl4]?
data.answer: It reveals well-preserved local ordering upon melting and evidence of extended-range order in the liquid phase

data.question: What is the activation energy (Ea) range for the liquid phases of the metal–bis(acetamide) networks right above their melting temperatures?
How does the viscosity of Mn(bba)3[MnCl4] compare to conventional ionic liquids near its melting temperature?
data.answer: It has a significantly higher viscosity, indicative of slower structural relaxation

data.question: What does the presence of quasiperiodic oscillations in the PDF of the liquid phase of Co(bba)3[CoCl4] indicate?
data.answer: It indicates the presence of extended-range structural correlations in the liquid phase

data.question: Is the glass transition temperature (Tg) of Co(hmba)3[CoBr4] higher or lower than its melting temperature (Tm)?
